snippet: A military court convicted Ahmed Abu Deraa of entering a military zone without authorization, but postponed his sentence indefinitely, a mixed decision in a test of media freedom.
abstract: Egyptian military court sentences journalist Ahmed Abu Deraa to six months in prison for entering military zone in lawless Sinai region without authorization, but defers sentence indefinitely; mixed verdict appears to be political compromise in closely watched test of news media freedom under country's new government.
lead_paragraph: A military court convicted Ahmed Abu Deraa of entering a military zone without authorization, but postponed his sentence indefinitely, a mixed decision in a test of media freedom.

headline.main: Court Defers Imprisonment for Journalist Covering Sinai
headline.print_headline: Court Defers Imprisonment For Journalist Covering Sinai
